text: My name is Sherry Marcus.
I'm a Director of Applied Science at AWS,

and I lead generative AI science and engineering
teams in support of Bedrock and Titan.
Titan is a series of generative AI models
that's been based on 25 years

of Amazon's extensive
experience in machine learning
and artificial intelligence.

Our approach to generative AI
that's unique is with respect
to responsible AI,

and we have six pillars
when we think about
and implement responsible AI.

These include things like
security, reliability,
appropriateness, and bias and fairness.

Our approach to security
with Titan is that customers,
when they train a model with Titan,

the data stays within
the customer's account
and is never used to train a Titan model.

Customers are using Titan in
primarily four different ways.
The first is question

and answering where they have
a large document repository
and they ask questions to the repository
to get specific answers.
The second is conversational AI,
as you might find in call centers,

to accelerate the mechanism
for helping customers.
The third is in the area of summarization
where you have a large document repository

and you're looking to
summarize specific documents.

And lastly, it's in content generation
where you have a question,

and you're looking to generate a
specific report or document on something.

Now, these models can help
you search from, on vector

databases, which can contain
image or text documents,
or they can help you create new content in
images or in text.

The biggest theme I'm
hearing from customers today
is about choice.

Customers want to be able
to choose the model
or models that they want to work on.
We also, at Amazon believe
that one model does not rule them all.
